result.rationale: This species has an extent of occurrence (EOO) of 1,688 km<sup>2</sup> and a known area of occupancy (AOO) of 16 km<sup>2</sup>. There is evidence that its habitat is being deforested for the settlement of small scale farms, but there is not enough information to establish the number of locations. Therefore, it is assessed as Near Threatened.
result.geographicrange: This species is known from the Guiana Shield. It is present in the Cataniapo river, upper Orinoco drainage, in Amazonas state.
result.population: There are no data available to estimate the population size.
result.habitat: This species inhabits streams and creeks, usually found in and near waterfalls, with rocky and sandy bottoms (Machado-Allison et al. 1996).
result.threats: The main threat is represented by habitat loss due to the settlement of small scale farms (Oliveira-Miranda et al. 2010).
result.conservationmeasures: The species is not known from any protected areas, but there is a need for habitat protection at sites where it is known to occur.
result.usetrade: It is unknown if this species is traded in the ornamental fish market, or if it is part of the livelihoods of indigenous peoples.
